description: The B.C. Supreme Court says it has jurisdiction to order the disposal of thousands of pieces of evidence seized from Robert Pickton’s pig farm decades ago, whether it was used in his murder trial or not. The court says in a ruling issued online today that the RCMP can apply to dispose of some 15,000 […]
title: BC Court Allows Police to Apply to Dispose of Evidence at Serial Killer’s Property

description: A look into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Trump Wins White House, Record-High Stock Market, and a Commemorative March

description: China's foreign ministry spokeswoman says Beijing wants 'peaceful coexistence' and 'win-win cooperation' with Washington.
title: Asia-Pacific Leaders, But Not China, Congratulate Trump

description: With Donald Trump having won a second term as U.S. president, several premiers are looking to strengthen trade and energy ties with Canada’s southern neighbour. Trump was declared the projected winner of the U.S. presidential election early on Nov. 6. He had secured 292 electoral votes by publication time, and was leading in the remaining […]
title: Trump’s 2024 Win: Reactions From Canadian Premiers on Trade, Energy

description: Parliament should penalize companies like Google and Facebook if they fail to identify and control “undesirable or questionable” content on the internet, according to a House of Commons heritage committee report. The November 2024 report included a recommendation that social media platforms put in place mechanisms to detect content that may be the product of […]
title: Social Media Companies Should be Penalized for ‘Questionable’ Information, House Report Says

description: A Canadian non-profit organization is taking WestJet to court over a reimbursement policy it says misleads passengers about their legal rights when flights are delayed or cancelled. The group Air Passenger Rights (APR) says a reimbursement guideline that had been posted on the WestJet website puts a cap on how much passengers are entitled to […]
title: Passenger Rights Group Files Legal Action Over WestJet Reimbursement Policy

description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre congratulated Donald Trump on his election victory in a post on social media, while highlighting the need for tax cuts to protect Canadian jobs amid the potential rise in competition from the United States. “Yesterday’s [election] result confirms we must cancel [Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s] plan to quadruple the carbon tax […]
title: Poilievre Says Tax Cuts Needed to Save Canadian Jobs After Trump Win

description: British Columbia port employers say they may be “required to reassess” their position on a current offer to more than 700 unionized workers as a lockout shuts down most shipping on the West Coast. The BC Maritime Employers Association says there has been no engagement with International Longshore and Warehouse Union Local 514 or federal […]
title: No Talks Scheduled in Standoff Between Employers, Union in BC Port Lockout

description: The Bank of Canada’s senior deputy governor is warning against adjusting mortgage rules to try to make the prospect of home ownership more affordable. Carolyn Rogers is delivering a speech today on the mortgage market to the Economic Club of Canada in Toronto. She says improving housing affordability ultimately requires reaching a balance between supply […]
title: BoC Official Warns Against Playing With Mortgage Rules to Make Housing Affordable

description: Germany wants to adopt a stronger defense policy in response to the Ukraine–Russia conflict, raising questions about conscription, which was abolished in 2011.
title: Germany Approves Draft Law Requiring Young Men to Answer Voluntary Military Service Survey

description: Several Canadian business groups are calling for federal and provincial governments to act in lockstep on economic issues in response to the election of Donald Trump, who has vowed to return to his “America First” policies by imposing tariffs on imports from other countries. “The US election results hold significant implications for Canadian small businesses. […]
title: Canadian Business Associations Call for ‘Unified’ Approach to Trump’s Election Win

description: Quebec Premier François Legault says his government is prepared to use the notwithstanding clause to force doctors trained in Quebec to begin their careers in the province’s public system. The premier says his government is looking at requiring medical graduates from Quebec universities to reimburse the government the cost of their education unless they practise […]
title: Quebec ‘Ready to Use’ Notwithstanding Clause to Force Doctors to Practise in Province

description: In November 2020, physicist Mohsen Fakhrizadeh, the alleged head of Iran’s nuclear weapons program, was shot dead during an incident in Tehran.
title: Iran Sentences 3 People to Death Over Assassination of Nuclear Scientist

description: U.S. stocks surged after Republican candidate Donald Trump won the election, with the Dow Jones industrial average gaining more than 1,300 points by late morning, while Canadian markets were more muted but also rose. “It looks like the 2016 playbook all over again,” said John Zechner, chairman and lead equity manager at J. Zechner Associates. […]
title: Dow up More Than 3% After Trump Win as US Stocks Surge, Canadian Markets Also Rise

description: The heat for the Westminster scheme will come from 'innovative sources,' such as the London Underground and the Thames.
title: £1 Billion Scheme Could Deliver Low Carbon Heating to London’s Landmarks

description: Disgraced doctor Thomas Kwan was motivated by money when he disguised himself as a community nurse and tried to poison his mother's partner.
title: GP Jailed for 31 Years for Fake COVID-19 Jab Murder Attempt

description: Official data estimates a record 2.8 million people currently claiming long-term sickness.
title: Surge in Long-Term Sickness Causing ‘Triple Whammy’ to Economy: OBR

description: 'Russia will work with the new administration. ... Our terms have not changed and are well-known,' a spokeswoman for Russia’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs said.
title: Moscow Still Open to Talks With US, Kremlin Says After Trump Election Win

description: Canadians can now purchase poppies and other Remembrance Day items on Amazon, as the Royal Canadian Legion teams up with the e-commerce giant. “We’re always kind of contemplating how best to reach more Canadians and to also make it easier for them to be part of this whole remembrance period,” Legion communications manager Nujma Bond […]
title: Canadian Legion Poppy Campaign Goes Live on Amazon

description: Two women crashed the same SUV into the same parked vehicle in a Prince George, B.C., parking lot last week, leading officers to arrest both drivers for intoxication, police say. Prince George RCMP responded to a report of an impaired driver at 12 p.m. on Oct. 29 after witnesses said an SUV had struck a […]
title: ‘Impaired’ BC Driver Swaps Places with Passenger Post-Crash, Results in Second Collision: RCMP

description: The steeplechaser was stabbed to death on New Year’s Eve 2023 in Eldoret, western Kenya, a city where many top athletes live.
title: Men Sentenced to 35 Years for 2023 Murder of Athlete Benjamin Kiplagat in Kenya

description: Albert’s growing population has prompted the provincial government to table legislation to add two new seats to the legislature for the next election. Justice Minister Mickey Amery has proposed changes to the Electoral Boundaries Commission Act calling for the creation of two new electoral districts prior to the 2027 general election. The change would bring […]
title: Alberta Boosting Legislature Seat Count By 2 Ahead of Next Election

description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico—Hurricane Rafael strengthened into a Category 2 storm on Wednesday just hours before it was forecast to make landfall on Wednesday in western Cuba. It was another stroke of bad news for Cuba, which has been struggling with blackouts while recovering from another hurricane two weeks ago that killed at least six […]
title: Hurricane Rafael Becomes Category 2 Storm as It Barrels Toward Cuba

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau congratulated Republican candidate Donald Trump for winning a second term as U.S. president, emphasizing close ties between the countries and previous trade negotiations which culminated into agreements. “On behalf of the Government of Canada, I congratulate Donald Trump on being elected as President of the United States of America for a […]
title: Trump Victory: Trudeau Stresses Strength of Canada-US Relations in Congratulatory Statement

description: German authorities said that members of the extremist group deeply reject the liberal democratic basic order of Germany.
title: Alternative for Germany to Expel ‘Saxonian Separatists’ From Party

description: The Toronto Regional Real Estate Board says home sales in October surged as buyers continued moving off the sidelines amid lower interest rates. The board said 6,658 homes changed hands last month in the Greater Toronto Area, up 44.4 percent compared with 4,611 in the same month last year. Sales were up 14 percent from […]
title: Greater Toronto Home Sales Jump in October After Bank of Canada Rate Cuts: Board

description: PAIPORTA/MADRID—At least 89 people remain missing after deadly floods in eastern Spain, the regional judicial authorities in Valencia said on Tuesday, and Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said he was earmarking 10.6 billion euros ($11.6 billion) to help victims. The number includes only those who have been reported missing by family members that have also provided […]
title: At Least 89 People Missing From Floods in Eastern Spain

description: Cash-strapped councils in England have been calling on the government to increase funding or risk closures of services to residents, including in social care.
title: Over 80 Percent of England Councils to Overspend on Adult Social Care: Survey

description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said there a 'crisis of trust' had led to his decision to dismiss Yoav Gallant and replace him with Israel Katz.
title: Protests Erupt In Israel After Netanyahu Sacks Defense Minister Gallant

description: Issues that may challenge historically close relations between the UK and the United States include the Russia–Ukraine conflict and trade tariffs.
title: Starmer Congratulates Trump and Says ‘Special Relationship’ Will Prosper

description: An unprecedented number of fires were ignited in protected areas in 2024, destroying indigenous homes, farms, and animals.
title: Bolivians Say Private Interest Groups Are Causing Record Fire Devastation in Forests

description: Reactions from world leaders have begun to pour in, congratulating Donald Trump on winning the presidency again as projected by Decision Desk.

description: A hurricane warning has been issued for the Cayman Islands and several Cuban provinces.

description: Both the leaders also paid tribute to outgoing US President Joe Biden.

description: 'The additional cost for the domestic decarbonisation task is between $500 and $800 billion, going from no abatement target to net zero,' said Michael Brear.

description: Short-term, fixed-rate mortgages are gaining popularity among Canadian homebuyers, partly due to expectations that interest rates will fall in the coming years, a report from the Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation suggests. Homebuyers are increasingly choosing fixed-rate, shorter-term mortgages instead of the standard five-year agreements, according to the report. The trend has been growing since […]
title: Popularity of Short-Term Mortgages on the Rise in Canada: Report

description: Former Defence Minister Harjit Sajjan defended the attempted rescue mission of Sikhs during the 2021 withdrawal from Afghanistan, saying it was part of a government policy of evacuating vulnerable individuals to Canada that had been discussed months before the fall of Kabul. Sajjan, who is currently minister of emergency preparedness, said during a Nov. 5 […]
title: ‘I Did Not Order a Rescue’: Sajjan Defends 2021 Evacuation of Sikhs From Afghanistan

description: A fatal gust lifted an inflatable jumping castle into the air and killed 6 children in Tasmania in December 2021.

description: Paul Burns asked students that if they believed the world was overpopulated then they should commit suicide.

description: Experts said the two candidates are expected to take the same direction, but differences lie in their approaches, particularly on the war in Ukraine.

description: Adding gunshot sounds to a story and misleadingly editing an interview were not attempts to slant the story, the Corporation claimed.

description: AFP has executed 3 search warrants, seized mobile devices, and confiscated clothing items allegedly bearing terrorist symbols.

description: U.S. Army Sgt. Quandarius Davon Stanley was injured while supporting the Gaza aid pier mission in May and died on Oct. 31.

description: The City of Hamilton has created its first commemorative Remembrance Day crosswalk in collaboration with the local veterans. Christopher Redford, heritage presentation coordinator for the city, told The Epoch Times in a phone interview that they looked at several designs before deciding on one. The crosswalk has painted red and white stripes along with a […]
title: Hamilton Unveils Remembrance Day Crosswalk to Honour Veterans

description: A national security adviser to Lithuanian president said that depot sabotage was part of 'unconventional kinetic operations against NATO countries.'
title: Lithuania Accuses Russia of Orchestrating Parcel Fires Across Poland, Germany, and UK

description: The conflict between Sikh Khalistani activists and Hindu groups in Ontario was raised in the House of Commons on Nov. 5, with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau condemning the violence and Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre blaming the government for the divisions. “The individuals who are inciting violence, division and hatred in no way represent either the Sikh […]
title: Trudeau, Poilievre Address Violent Clash at Brampton Hindu Temple
